summary: This is an email from September 17, 2019, providing an update on the investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell. It mentions her boyfriend Scott Borgenson, her location in Manchester By the Sea, MA, and that the FBI is tracking a cell phone believed to belong to her and has subpoenaed subscriber information.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The document is an update on the investigation into Maxwell, noting she was with her boyfriend Scott Borgenson but left after media scrutiny, and that the FBI is tracking a cell phone believed to be hers.

persons.name: Scott Borgenson
persons.context: Identified as Ghislaine Maxwell's boyfriend who lives in Manchester By the Sea, MA. The local police were in contact with him in August and have a good relationship with him.

connections.description: Described as boyfriend-girlfriend relationship; Maxwell was with Borgenson but left after media scrutiny.

events.title: Police contact with Scott Borgenson
events.description: The Manchester By the Sea Police Department was in contact with Scott Borgenson earlier in August regarding Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: FBI subpoenas cell phone info
events.description: The FBI subpoenaed subscriber information for a cell phone they believe belongs to Ghislaine Maxwell as part of their investigation.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's boyfriend, Scott Borgenson, lives in Manchester By the Sea, Massachusetts.
Maxwell was with Borgenson but left the location after increased media scrutiny.
The local police department has a good relationship with Scott Borgenson and had been in contact with him in August 2019.
The FBI is actively tracking a cell phone they believe belongs to Ghislaine Maxwell and has subpoenaed subscriber information for it.
The correspondence is an internal FBI update from the Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking unit in the New York office.
